data.description: Location(s):United States of AmericaCity/Cities:AtlantaTravel Required:00% - 25%Relocation Provided:NoJob Posting End Date:January 23, 2026Shift:Job Description Summary: Candidates are encouraged to apply to 3 or fewer internship roles during a given internship recruiting cycleWe are seeking a highly motivated Data Engineering Intern to support data platform development and analytics initiatives within Commercial Product Supply (CPS). CPS oversees manufacturing plants globally and is responsible for ensuring reliable, efficient, and compliant product supply across regions. This role offers hands-on experience working with global data systems that support plant operations, supply chain visibility, and business decision-making.Function Related Activities/Key Responsibilities:Assist in building, maintaining, and optimizing data pipelines using Azure Data Factory (ADF) and DatabricksDevelop, transform, and analyze datasets using PySpark, SQL, and PythonSupport ingestion of data from global manufacturing plants and enterprise systemsPerform data validation, quality checks, and monitoring to ensure data reliabilityCollaborate with data engineers and business stakeholders to troubleshoot and resolve pipeline issuesParticipate in data modeling, performance tuning, and optimization effortsContribute to documentation of data workflows, pipelines, and technical standardsOccasionally support lightweight web development tasks for internal dashboards or toolsEducation Requirements:Must be currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree or have graduated from their degree program no earlier than December 2025 in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Software Engineering, or a related engineering discipline. Related Work Experience:Prior internship, academic projects, or relevant coursework in data engineering, software development, or analytics preferredExposure to cloud platforms, particularly Microsoft Azure, is a plusFunctional Skills:Proficiency in Python and SQLWorking knowledge or coursework experience with PySpark and distributed data processingFamiliarity with Databricks and Azure Data Factory (ADF)Understanding of ETL/ELT concepts, data modeling, and relational databasesBasic web development skills (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, or similar) are a plusSoft SkillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsEagerness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced, global environmentEffective written and verbal communication skillsAbility to collaborate with cross-functional and geographically distributed teamsStrong attention to detail and commitment to data qualityMonthly Salary (undergraduate): $4,506Monthly Salary (graduate): $6,066Location: Atlanta, GeorgiaDates of Internship: May 18 - July 31, 2026Skills:Our Purpose and Growth Culture:We are taking deliberate action to nurture an inclusive culture that is grounded in our company purpose, to refresh the world and make a difference. We act with a growth mindset, take an expansive approach to what’s possible and believe in continuous learning to improve our business and ourselves. We focus on four key behaviors – curious, empowered, inclusive and agile – and value how we work as much as what we achieve. We believe that our culture is one of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years. Visit Our Purpose and Vision to learn more about these behaviors and how you can bring them to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. When we collect your personal information as part of a job application or offer of employment, we do so in accordance with industry standards and best practices and in compliance with applicable privacy laws.
requirements: Must be currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree or have graduated from their degree program no earlier than December 2025 in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Software Engineering, or a related engineering discipline.
responsibilities: Develop, transform, and analyze datasets using PySpark, SQL, and Python
Collaborate with data engineers and business stakeholders to troubleshoot and resolve pipeline issues
Occasionally support lightweight web development tasks for internal dashboards or tools
Prior internship, academic projects, or relevant coursework in data engineering, software development, or analytics preferred
Basic web development skills (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, or similar) are a plus
Ability to collaborate with cross-functional and geographically distributed teams
